extendedIngredients.name: anaheim peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 poblano or anaheim peppers, seeded and thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: bean thread noodles
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 small bundles from a 3.75 ounce package of bean thread noodles, there is usually 3 bundles in one package (recommended: Kame)

extendedIngredients.name: carrots
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup shredded carrots, available in pouches in the produce department

extendedIngredients.name: chicken tenders
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 pound chicken tenders cut into bite size chunks, 2 packages
metaInformation: cut into bite size chunks, 2 packages

extendedIngredients.name: garlic cloves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 garlic cloves, peeled and finely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: vegetable oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 turns of the pan

extendedIngredients.name: yellow onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium size yellow onion, peeled, quartered and thinly sliced

recipes.title: MYOTO - Make Your Own Take Out: Thai Chicken Noodle Soup

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Heat a large heavy-bottomed soup pot with vegetable oil, 2 turns of the pan, over high heat. Once you see the oil ripple, add the sliced onion, chopped garlic and sliced peppers. Season the vegetables with salt and pepper and cook, stirring frequently, for 2 minutes. Add 1 cup shredded carrot and 6 cups chicken stock or broth. Cover with a lid and bring up to a simmer. Once simmering, add the chicken simmer 5 minutes then add noodles and simmer 5 minutes more. Remove the soup from the heat and add the cilantro, basil and the juice of 1 lime.

steps.step: Heat a large heavy-bottomed soup pot with vegetable oil, 2 turns of the pan, over high heat. Once you see the oil ripple, add the sliced onion, chopped garlic and sliced peppers. Season the vegetables with salt and pepper and cook, stirring frequently, for 2 minutes.
Add 1 cup shredded carrot and 6 cups chicken stock or broth. Cover with a lid and bring up to a simmer. Once simmering, add the chicken simmer 5 minutes then add noodles and simmer 5 minutes more.
Remove the soup from the heat and add the cilantro, basil and the juice of 1 lime.
